Key Match Events: The Clippers had a 25-4 run in the second quarter where they took over.
The Hawks were outscored 45-26 in the second quarter.
Young and Matthews were the only Hawks in double-figures and had 12 each at the half.
The Clippers scored 32 points off of the Hawks 22 turnovers.
The Clippers had eight players in double figures, including 18 points and 18 rebounds from Ivica Zubac, who dominated tonight.
Post-Match Reflections: The Hawks have lost three games in a row and are now 18-18 overall.
The Hawks now have two days to get ready for the Utah Jazz and try to get things back on track.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers shot 55% from the field and 36% from three tonight.
The Clippers scored 74 points in the paint and had 69 points from their bench.
The Clippers won the fast break points battle 46-14, showing how devastating the Hawks's turnovers were.
The Hawks starters tonight were Trae Young, Dyson Daniels, Zaccharie Risacher, Vit Krejci, and Clint Capela.
The Clippers first five were James Harden, Kris Dunn, Norm Powell, Kawhi Leonard, and Ivica Zubac
Others: Jackson Caudell has been covering Georgia Tech Athletics For On SI since March 2022 and the Atlanta Hawks for On SI since October 2023.
Jackson is also the co-host of the Bleav in Georgia Tech podcast and he loves to bring thoughtful analysis and comprehensive coverage to everything that he does.
